SENT.plain: The case reported is the first description of an unusual form of Klippel-Trenaunay syndrome associating total hemihypertrophy to hemimegalencephaly and bilateral extremity enlargement
The patient complaints are related to her lower limb inequality; she presents dizziness, tinnitus and nystagmus which could be unusual consequences of hemimegalencephaly, disclosed at the EEG
Angiodysplasia is mild in regard to the hypertrophy whose cause is discussed
